title: How to Take Your Teddy Bear on Long Trips

steps.headline: Take your teddy bear, doll, or stuffed animal out on short car trips first.
steps.description: This will get him/her used to movement, which will decrease the likeliness of him/her getting ill through a longer trip.

steps.headline: Talk to your teddy bear, doll, or stuffed animal whenever you can.
steps.description: Comfort them, so they know they're safe wherever they go. Cuddle them. The main thing is to make sure they know to that they will be safe.

steps.headline: Knit, crochet, sew, or buy some clothes suitable for your travel, if you want.
steps.description: When you make them, show them to your teddy, doll, or stuffed animal and see if he/she likes them.

steps.headline: Pack everything you need.
steps.description: When the day of the journey comes, make sure you pack well. Your teddy, doll or stuffed animal needs everything you need. Keep him/her on your lap as much as possible.

steps.headline: Ask your teddy, doll, or stuffed animal if they want to come with you, sometimes teddies, dolls, and stuffed animals don't like travel or trips!
steps.description: Tell him/her about everything you are going to do!

steps.headline: Start taking your friend on small journeys.
steps.description: Sometimes taking your teddy, doll, or stuffed animal on small car journeys helps he/she get used to travel, and they won't feel ill on the day of the holiday! You don't want to be worrying about him/her.

steps.headline: Pack up a bag with your teddy, doll, or stuffed animal's things.
steps.description: You will need medicine in case he/she get sick, a small amount of food so he/she doesn't get hungry, and any toys he/she might want to play with such as books and computer games.

steps.headline: Don't forget clothes, if your teddy, doll, or stuffed animal is able to wear them!
steps.description: Pack the right sort for wherever you are going, like jackets and hats for cold places, and sunglasses and shorts for hot places.

steps.headline: Let your teddy, doll or stuffed animal sit on your lap.
steps.description: When you are traveling with your teddy, doll, or stuffed animal, sit him/her on your lap, and get him/her to relax. Make sure he/she gets some sleep to be more active when you arrive!

steps.headline: Getting to your holiday destination.
steps.description: Show your teddy, doll, or stuffed animal around your holiday home or hotel to make sure he/she knows where he/she now. If he/she has any furniture, you could bring it with you to make him/her feel more at home during their stay!

steps.headline: Take your teddy, doll, or stuffed animal out with you on most days.
steps.description: Don't bring him/her with you anywhere dangerous, where they could get lost or hurt!
